Issues.Title: Fix DragDropTests
Issues.Body:
* Make sure to start a drag/drop operation on DragEnter (DragOver may or may not occur due to test speed)
* Match Mouse Down with Mouse Up
* Remove artificial delays

⚠️ **DO NOT MERGE**: The updated tests are being forced to run 100 times each to demonstrate stability in CI
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix DragDropTests" (#8860)

Issues.Title: [Tracking] Replace InputSimulator with alternative in tests to make them reliable.
Issues.Body:
While investigating flaky tests that perform operation on the UI, we found InputSimulator used in tests is not reliable in clearing the input message queue and ensuring the operation is successfully performed. InputSimulator is a third party NuGet we use in tests and does not carry any support for the issues we encounter with it.

As an alternative, we discussed to replace it with our helpers with windows native APIs that perform UI operations in a more reliable way and update it as necessary.  This issue is to track efforts in this area and replace temporary solution made in #8772.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Tracking] Replace InputSimulator with alternative in tests to make them reliable." (#8810)

Issues.Title: Metroframework library worked in .NET 6 and Framework -- Crashes on .NET 7
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Worked on .NET 6

### Issue description

I was updating documentation on how to upgrade from .net 4 to .NET 6, updating the steps to .NET 7. The app I was using worked fine on .NET 6, but on .NET 7 it crashes unable to create the starting window.

I'm using a 3rd party library from NuGet that was made for .NET Framework, I chose it so that I could demonstrate upgrading NuGet packages. The bug is most certainly from the usage of that library, but the library hasn't been updated in a decade. But, like I was saying, it was written for .NET Framework, worked fine on .NET Core 3.1/.NET 5/.NET 6, but no longer with .NET 7. The designer seems to be fine.

The library is this: [Metroframework (thielj.github.io)](https://thielj.github.io/MetroFramework/)
NuGet: [NuGet Gallery | MetroFramework 1.2.0.3](https://www.nuget.org/packages/MetroFramework/)

### Steps to reproduce

[MatchingGame_Net7.zip code](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10972846/MatchingGame_Net7.zip)

Here is a sample project. If you change the TFM to .NET 6, it works fine. When you keep it as .NET 7, you get this crash

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67293991/225112725-4c61771b-f5f9-468f-a430-4bef661fa0f5.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Metroframework library worked in .NET 6 and Framework -- Crashes on .NET 7" (#8803)

Issues.Title: Fix ToolStripItems_FontScaling tests
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Locally, the tests are failing for me and it looks like it is because we are using `DpiHelper.LogicalDpi` which is always `96.0`. I used `Form.DeviceDpi` instead.

Issues.Title: TablelayoutPanelDesigner,TabControlDesigner is missing in .net7.0.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.net7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Designer surface code generation issue occur with table layout panel

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/1187787/private-member-code-generation-and-resize-issue-wi

### Steps to reproduce

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/1187787/private-member-code-generation-and-resize-issue-wi
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TablelayoutPanelDesigner,TabControlDesigner is missing in .net7.0." (#8790)
